item.title: Binary Classification
item.description: What is it? Classification, like Regression, is a supervised Machine Learning technique; and therefore follows the same iterative process of training, validating, and evaluating models.

item.title: Clustering
item.description: Clustering is a form of unsupervised Machine Learning in which observations are grouped into clusters based on similarities in their data values, or features.

item.title: Deep learning
item.description: Deep learning is an advanced form of Machine Learning that tries to emulate the way the human brain learns.

item.title: Foundations of AI
item.description: Modern AI is built on a foundation of data science and machine learning.

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: Fundamentally, a machine learning model is a software application that encapsulates a function to calculate an output value based on one or more input values.

item.title: Multiclass Classification
item.description: Multiclass classification is used to predict to which of multiple possible classes an observation belongs.

item.title: Regression
item.description: Regression models are trained to predict numeric label values based on training data that includes both features and known labels.

item.title: Transformers
item.description: Generative AI applications are powered by language models, which are a specialized type of machine learning model that you can use to perform natural language processing (NLP) tasks, including: Determining sentiment or otherwise classifying natural language text.

item.title: 3 Important Things
item.description: When analyzing a system that has been hacked or believed to have been hacked, regardless of the processing system, there are 3 questions that must be answered.

item.title: Bash_rc & Bash_profile
item.description: In order to maintain persistence, attackers change the .bashrc and .bash_profile files for their own benefit.
